title: Z Energy weekly fuel supply volumes

groups.name: Retail
groups.title: Z Energy weekly fuel supply volumes - retail
groups.caveats:
(1) Truckstops include Z and Caltex branded Truckstops, private Truckstops and Mini-Tankers.

(2) Other includes General Aviation and Lubricants.

(3) The values for the 22nd of March are the average weekly volumes for the preceeding four weeks (24/02/20-22/03/20). The subsequent values are weekly totals.

(4) Week ended data includes all fuel volumes for the prior week up to 11.59pm on Sunday.

groups.name: Other
groups.title: Z Energy weekly fuel supply volumes - other
groups.caveats:
(1) Z volumes will be retail fuel sales volumes including the Foodstuffs network.

(2) Domestic retail supply volume is the total bulk fuel delivered to distributor customers.

(3) The values for the 22nd of March are the average weekly volumes for the preceeding four weeks (24/02/20-22/03/20). The subsequent values are weekly totals.

(4) Week ended data includes all fuel volumes for the prior week up to 11.59pm on Sunday.

caveats:
1. Business lending includes temporary or term business lending, stock or equipment finance, and arranged overdrafts.

2. Amounts for new lending represents limits or limit increases.

3. Amounts for loans represents outstanding balance at date of conversion/reduction/deferral.

4. Reduced loan repayments represents interest-only, or reduced principal and/or interest repayments.

caveats:
(1) Weekly deaths data are based on Date of Death and differ from other deaths statistics based on date of registration. These data are provisional and subject to revision during the full process of producing death statistics.

(2) Totals are by Date of Death. Week beginning Monday.

(3) Weekly totals will differ from those in the death registrations time series as deaths are registered at the time of burial or cremation of the body.

(4) An average of 5% of Deaths are registered 2 weeks or more after Date of Death therefore weekly totals are expected to increase over time as Death Registrations are submitted and processed.

(5) Overseas addresses or where location could not be determined and records where the persons sex is missing or not in Male or Female have been excluded as these numbers are too low to publish a weekly total.

(6) The accuracy of any administrative data, which includes but is not limited to address information is subject to human error.

(7) The data provided has been collated to the best of our ability and may have a small variance to any alternative publications.

(3) Weekly totals will differ from those in the death registrations time series as deaths are registered at the time of burial or cremation of the body.

(4) An average of 5% of Deaths are registered 2 weeks or more after Date of Death therefore weekly totals are expected to increase over time as Death Registrations are submitted and processed.

(5) Overseas addresses or where location could not be determined and records where the persons sex is missing or not in Male or Female have been excluded as these numbers are too low to publish a weekly total.

(7) The data provided has been collated to the best of our ability and may have a small variance to any alternative publications.

indicator_name: Gas consumption by selected major users
caveats:
1) Please note that these charts are Stats NZ's interpretation of publicly available data specific to several large gas users as sourced from First Gas.

2) It is not designed to be a comprehensive representation of all gas use in New Zealand, nor is all data publicly available due to some gas being transported through private pipelines.

3) Gas consumption patterns are inclusive of planned and unplanned production outages.
